conclusion: Analyzing the p-V diagram and calculating heat transferred during the thermodynamic process.
State A: (V = 8×10⁻³ m³, p = 1×10⁵ Pa), State B: (V = 8×10⁻³ m³, p = 2×10⁵ Pa), State C: (V = 3×10⁻³ m³, p = 3×10⁵ Pa)
Process A→B is an isochoric (constant volume) process.
Process B→C involves changes in both pressure and volume.
Temperature at state A is given as 27°C, converted to 300 K.
Temperature at state B is calculated as 600 K using the ratio method.
Temperature at state C is calculated as 337.5 K using the ratio method.
Heat transfer during process A→B is calculated as Q₁→₂ = 300nR.
Work done during process B→C is calculated as W₂→₃ = -1250 J.
Change in internal energy during process B→C is calculated as ΔU₂→₃ = -393.75nR.
Heat transfer during process B→C is calculated as Q₂→₃ = -393.75nR - 1250.
Total heat transfer is calculated as Qtotal = -93.75nR - 1250.
Value of nR is calculated using the ideal gas law at state A as nR = 26.67 J/K.
Total heat transferred by the gas is calculated as -3.75 kJ.
The negative sign indicates that heat is released from the gas to the surroundings.
